intro: Miconia vazquezii, commonly known as the Vázquez's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
